snippet: Legal practitioners and Supreme Court justices say it is the rare oral argument that wins or loses a case.
abstract: News analysis questions the usefulness of analyzing the strength of oral arguments made before the Supreme Court, in light of the criticism that Solicitor General Donald B Verrilli Jr has received for his arguments in several cases; observes that oral arguments rarely win or lose cases.
lead_paragraph: Legal practitioners and Supreme Court justices say it is the rare oral argument that wins or loses a case.

headline.seo: Are Oral Arguments Worth Arguing About?
headline.main: Are Oral Arguments Worth Arguing About?
headline.print_headline: Are Oral Arguments Worth Arguing About?
